meanings.definition: Women considered collectively, especially within a particular community or family.
meanings.sent1: The womenfolk gathered at the community center for their weekly meeting.
meanings.sent2: The womenfolk in our family always come together for special occasions.
meanings.sent3: The womenfolk decided to have a bake-off to see who could make the best cookies.
meanings.sent4: The womenfolk were like a colorful bouquet, each bringing their unique strengths to the group.
meanings.sent5: The image of the womenfolk laughing and chatting under the old oak tree will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: The female members of a family or community.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother and aunts are the womenfolk who hold our family together.
meanings.sent2: The womenfolk in the village are known for their strong sense of community.
meanings.sent3: The womenfolk organized a surprise party for the village mayor.
meanings.sent4: The womenfolk were the pillars of strength during the difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The womenfolk's laughter echoed through the village, bringing joy to all who heard it.
